016package edu.cnm.deepdive.rps.viewmodel;
017
018import android.content.Context;
019import android.content.res.Resources;
020import android.util.Log;
021import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
022import androidx.lifecycle.DefaultLifecycleObserver;
023import androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner;
024import androidx.lifecycle.LiveData;
025import androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData;
026import androidx.lifecycle.Transformations;
027import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModel;
028import dagger.hilt.android.lifecycle.HiltViewModel;
029import dagger.hilt.android.qualifiers.ApplicationContext;
030import edu.cnm.deepdive.rps.R;
031import edu.cnm.deepdive.rps.model.domain.Ecosystem;
032import edu.cnm.deepdive.rps.service.EcosystemRepository;
033import edu.cnm.deepdive.rps.service.PreferencesRepository;
034import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.Completable;
035import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.Observable;
036import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.Single;
037import io.reactivex.rxjava3.disposables.CompositeDisposable;
038import io.reactivex.rxjava3.functions.Action;
039import io.reactivex.rxjava3.functions.Consumer;
040import javax.inject.Inject;
041
042/**
043 * Provides UI controller access to {@link LiveData} containers for ecosystem components. Some of
044 * the available components may not be required for the required functionality or user experience,
045 * and almost all can be obtained by observing the return value of {@link #getEcosystem()}; however,
046 * as a convenience, properties of that ecosystem can be observed directly, using other methods of
047 * this class,
048 */
049@HiltViewModel
050public class EcosystemViewModel extends ViewModel implements DefaultLifecycleObserver {
051
052  private static final int TICK_MILLISECONDS = 10;
053
054  private final EcosystemRepository ecosystemRepository;
055  private final PreferencesRepository preferencesRepository;
056  private final LiveData<int[][]> terrain;
057  private final LiveData<Integer> size;
058  private final LiveData<Integer> initialBreedCount;
059  private final LiveData<Integer> currentBreedCount;
060  private final LiveData<int[]> populations;
061  private final LiveData<Long> iterationCount;
062  private final LiveData<Boolean> absorbed;
063  private final MutableLiveData<Throwable> throwable;
064  private final CompositeDisposable pending;
065  private final String numBreedsKey;
066  private final int numBreedsDefault;
067  private final String terrainSizeKey;
068  private final int terrainSizeDefault;
069  private final String toroidalTopologyKey;
070  private final boolean toroidalTopologyDefault;
071
072  // TODO Define final String and int fields for the run speed key and the run speed default,
073  //  respectively.
074
075  // TODO Define final String and int fields for the swap likelihood key and the swap likelihood
076  //  default, respectively.
077
078  private int currentTerrainSize;
079
080  @Inject
081  EcosystemViewModel(@ApplicationContext Context context,
082      EcosystemRepository ecosystemRepository, PreferencesRepository preferencesRepository) {
083    this.ecosystemRepository = ecosystemRepository;
084    this.preferencesRepository = preferencesRepository;
085
086    LiveData<Ecosystem> source = ecosystemRepository.getEcosystem();
087    terrain = Transformations.map(source, Ecosystem::getTerrain);
088    size = Transformations.map(source, Ecosystem::getSize);
089    initialBreedCount = Transformations.map(source, Ecosystem::getInitialBreedCount);
090    currentBreedCount = Transformations.map(source, Ecosystem::getCurrentBreedCount);
091    populations = Transformations.map(source, Ecosystem::getPopulations);
092    iterationCount = Transformations.map(source, Ecosystem::getIterationCount);
093    absorbed = Transformations.map(source, Ecosystem::isAbsorbed);
094    throwable = new MutableLiveData<>();
095    pending = new CompositeDisposable();
096
097    Resources res = context.getResources();
098    numBreedsKey = res.getString(R.string.num_breeds_key);
099    numBreedsDefault = res.getInteger(R.integer.num_breeds_default);
100    terrainSizeKey = res.getString(R.string.terrain_size_key);
101    terrainSizeDefault = res.getInteger(R.integer.terrain_size_default);
102    toroidalTopologyKey = res.getString(R.string.toroidal_topology_key);
103    toroidalTopologyDefault = res.getBoolean(R.bool.toroidal_topology_default);
104
105    // TODO Assign values to the run speed key and run speed default fields. See
106    //  res/xml/settings.xml for the resources involved; see the above code used to assign values to
107    //  the key and default fields for an illustration of the technique.
108
109    // TODO Assign values to the swap likelihood key and swap likelihood default fields. See
110    //  res/xml/settings.xml for the resources involved; see the above code used to assign values to
111    //    //  the key and default fields for an illustration of the technique.
112
113    create();
114  }
115
116  /**
117   * Creates a new instance of the intransitive ecosystem simulation, using the number of breeds,
118   * terrain size, and topology specified in the corresponding property values stored in
119   * {@link android.content.SharedPreferences}.
120   */
121  public void create() {
122    int numBreeds = preferencesRepository.get(numBreedsKey, numBreedsDefault);
123    int terrainSize = preferencesRepository.get(terrainSizeKey, terrainSizeDefault);
124    boolean toroidal = preferencesRepository.get(toroidalTopologyKey, toroidalTopologyDefault);
125    execute(ecosystemRepository.create(numBreeds, terrainSize, toroidal),
126        (ecosystem) -> currentTerrainSize = ecosystem.getSize());
127  }
128
129  /**
130   * Starts (or resumes) execution of the simulation. The speed of execution and the probability
131   * of random element swaps in each iteration are derived from property values stored in
132   * {@link android.content.SharedPreferences}.
133   */
134  public void run() {
135
136    // TODO Declare an int local variable for the run speed; then, using the run speed key and run
137    //  speed default value fields (as outlined in the to-do items, above), obtain the run speed
138    //  value from preferencesRepository, using the technique illustrated in the create() method
139    //  (above).
140
141    // TODO Declare an int local variable for the swap likelihood; then, using the swap likelihood
142    //  key and swap likelihood default value fields (as outlined in the to-do items, above), obtain
143    //  the swap likelihood value from preferencesRepository, using the technique illustrated in the
144    //  create() method (above).
145
146    // TODO In the ecosystemRepository.run() method invocation below, specify the argument for the
147    //  iterationsPerBatch parameter (currently 100) as a value computed from the run speed
148    //  (obtained from the preferences earlier in this method) and the current terrain size.
149    //  ---
150    //  Note that while run speed must come from the preferences, the terrain size should be taken
151    //  from the currentTerrainSize field, NOT from the preferences. This is because preferences can
152    //  be modified after creating an ecosystem, but some of them (including terrain size) don't
153    //  take effect until the next time an ecosystem is created; thus, when invoking the run method,
154    //  we need to take the terrain size component of our iterationsPerBatch parameter value
155    //  calculation from the current ecosystem. For this purpose, the create method (above) is
156    //  already capturing the ecosystem size to the currentTerrainSize field.
157    //  ---
158    //  The run_speed preference value is an integer in the range 1..5; you must multiply
159    //  that number by the number of elements in the terrain (that is, currentTerrainSize *
160    //  currentTerrainSize), then divide by 25, and use that result (expressed as an int) as the
161    //  first argument to the ecosystemRepository.run() method invocation below.
162    //  ---
163    //  In other words, given all of the above, and if we assume that (earlier in this method) we
164    //  declare an int variable runSpeed, assigning it a value from the preferences, the first
165    //  argument in the ecosystemRepository.run() method invocation (below) should be computed as
166    //  (runSpeed * currentTerrainSize * currentTerrainSize / 25).
167
168    // TODO In the ecosystemRepository.run() method invocation below, specify the value of the
169    //  swapProbability parameter (currently 0) with a value computed from the swap likelihood
170    //  (obtained from preferences earlier in this method).
171    //  ---
172    //  The swap_likelihood preference value is an integer in the range 0..10; you must divide that
173    //  value by 100f before using the result (expressed as a float) as the second argument to the
174    //  ecosystemRepository.run() method invocation below.
175    //  ---
176    //  In other words, given the above, and if we assume that (earlier in this method) we declare
177    //  an int variable swapLikelihood, assigning it a value from the preferences, the second
178    //  argument in the ecosystemRepository.run() method invocation (below) should be computed as
179    //  (swapLikelihood / 100f).
180
181    execute(ecosystemRepository.run(100, 0, TICK_MILLISECONDS), (ignored) -> {}, () -> {});
182  }
183
184  /**
185   * Suspends execution of the simulation.
186   */
187  public void pause() {
188    execute(ecosystemRepository.pause(), () -> {});
189  }
190
191  /**
192   * Returns a reference to a {@link LiveData LiveData&lt;Ecosystem&gt;} containing the current
193   * ecosystem.
194   */
195  public LiveData<Ecosystem> getEcosystem() {
196    return ecosystemRepository.getEcosystem();
197  }
198
199  /**
200   * Returns a reference to a {@link LiveData LiveData&lt;int[][]&gt;} containing the ecosystem's
201   * terrain contents.
202   */
203  public LiveData<int[][]> getTerrain() {
204    return terrain;
205  }
206
207  /**
208   * Returns a reference to a {@link LiveData LiveData&lt;Integer&gt;} containing the ecosystem's
209   * size. (Note that in this implementation, the ecosystem's height and width are equal; the size
210   * is thus equal to both the height and width.)
211   */
212  public LiveData<Integer> getSize() {
213    return Transformations.distinctUntilChanged(size);
214  }
215
216  /**
217   * Returns a reference to a {@link LiveData LiveData&lt;Integer&gt;} containing the ecosystem's
218   * initial number of breeds (it does not reflect any breed extinctions that may have taken place
219   * in the simulation).
220   */
221  public LiveData<Integer> getInitialBreedCount() {
222    return Transformations.distinctUntilChanged(initialBreedCount);
223  }
224
225  /**
226   * Returns a reference to a {@link LiveData LiveData&lt;Integer&gt;} containing the ecosystem's
227   * current number of breeds. This value reflects all breed extinctions that may have taken place
228   * in the simulation so far.
229   */
230  public LiveData<Integer> getCurrentBreedCount() {
231    return Transformations.distinctUntilChanged(currentBreedCount);
232  }
233
234  /**
235   * Returns a reference to a {@link LiveData LiveData&lt;int[]&gt;} containing the ecosystem's
236   * current breed population sizes.
237   */
238  public LiveData<int[]> getPopulations() {
239    return populations;
240  }
241
242  /**
243   * Returns a reference to a {@link LiveData LiveData&lt;Long&gt;} containing the ecosystem's
244   * current iteration count.
245   */
246  public LiveData<Long> getIterationCount() {
247    return iterationCount;
248  }
249
250  /**
251   * Returns a reference to a {@link LiveData LiveData&lt;Boolean&gt;} containing a flag indicating
252   * whether the ecosystem is in the absorbing state, in which all breeds but one are extinct.
253   */
254  public LiveData<Boolean> getAbsorbed() {
255    return Transformations.distinctUntilChanged(absorbed);
256  }
257
258  /**
259   * Returns a reference to a {@link LiveData LiveData&lt;Boolean&gt;} containing a flag indicating
260   * whether the simulation is running or paused.
261   */
262  public LiveData<Boolean> getRunning() {
263    return Transformations.distinctUntilChanged(ecosystemRepository.getRunning());
264  }
265
266  /**
267   * Returns a reference to a {@link LiveData LiveData&lt;Throwable&gt;} containing the exception
268   * thrown (if any) by the most recent operation.
269   */
270  public LiveData<Throwable> getThrowable() {
271    return throwable;
272  }
273
274  /**
275   * If the lifecycle being observed by this viewmodel reaches the PAUSED state, the simulation is
276   * paused.
277   *
278   * @param owner
279   * @noinspection JavadocDeclaration
280   */
281  @Override
282  public void onPause(@NonNull LifecycleOwner owner) {
283    pause();
284    DefaultLifecycleObserver.super.onPause(owner);
285  }
286
287  /**
288   * If the lifecycle being observed by this viewmodel reaches the STOPPED state, subscribers are
289   * removed from any in-progress asynchronous operations.
290   *
291   * @param owner
292   * @noinspection JavadocDeclaration
293   */
294  @Override
295  public void onStop(@NonNull LifecycleOwner owner) {
296    pending.clear();
297    DefaultLifecycleObserver.super.onStop(owner);
298  }
299
300  private void execute(Completable task, Action action) {
301    throwable.postValue(null);
302    task.subscribe(action, this::postThrowable, pending);
303  }
304
305  private <T> void execute(Single<T> task, Consumer<? super T> consumer) {
306    throwable.postValue(null);
307    task.subscribe(consumer, this::postThrowable, pending);
308  }
309
310  private <T> void execute(Observable<T> task, Consumer<? super T> consumer, Action action) {
311    throwable.postValue(null);
312    task.subscribe(consumer, this::postThrowable, action, pending);
313  }
314
315  private void postThrowable(Throwable throwable) {
316    Log.e(getClass().getSimpleName(), throwable.getMessage(), throwable);
317    this.throwable.postValue(throwable);
318  }
319
320}
